## How Do We Test?

Figuring out the top portable speakers of the year is no longer just about the
sound quality. There are multiple factors to consider as wireless speakers can
now do a lot more than playing songs.

### Portability

Being able to carry theÂ speakers anywhere you go is probably the most
important aspect of portable Bluetooth speakers. As a result, things to keep
in mind are weight, size, shape, and ease of carrying.

### Battery Life

Having your speaker last is crucial as that is what ultimately has made
Bluetooth speakers so popular â€“ portable, long-lasting music on the go. Each
wireless speaker has a different battery life, so make sure to check it before
buying it. However, if you would like to extend the playing time, even more,
[consider the top power banks](https://www.crunchreviews.com/gadgets/best-
power-bank/)Â for the job. Some can hold more battery capacity that the
speaker itself.

### Sound Quality

The audio quality may not be your most important criteria when choosing the
speakers, but I have to assume it is one of the top ones. Since we all love
music, we all appreciate a good sound quality even when we are out on a picnic
or the beach. Most of the time the sound quality and portability are working
against each other. You see, to get a better sound, you usually need to have
larger drivers. To power bigger drivers, you need bigger batteries. All of
which generally ads more size and weight andÂ consequently reduces the
portability. We do have to admit though that some manufacturers have managed
to strike a fantastic balance which almost pushes the limits of physics.

### Durability

Depending on your needs, you may require a portable Bluetooth speaker to have
a rugged design. Some speakers come with shock protection or water resistance,
some have both. Furthermore, if you need your speaker for an active sports use
that has water or dust exposure, you may want to look for speakers that have
anÂ [IP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IP_Code)Â rating.

### Connectivity

There areÂ mainly three types of connections â€“Â physical 3.5mm aux input,
Bluetooth orÂ Wi-Fi. Based on your needs, you will need to pick a speaker that
supports your connection type preference.

Note, that most speakers can be connected to as an audio source but not the
other way around. This means that [your wireless in-ear
headphones](https://www.crunchreviews.com/audio/best-wireless-in-ear-
headphones/) may need to find some other source if there is ever a need.

### Extra Features

Extra features may not be for everyone, yet some may find it quite useful.
Those features may include built-in voice assistants support such as Amazon
Alexa, the ability to charge other devices, multi-room setup, light equalizer
show and many more.

### Price

Although the Bluetooth speakers are a lot more affordable these days than they
were a couple of years back, some may still get quite pricey. Generally, the
more expensive the speaker is, the better the audio quality it delivers.
Conversely, you may find some speakers around a $50 price point that would

##### How Do Bluetooth Speakers Work?

Bluetooth speakers use a wireless transmission that connects two devices
together and allows them to exchange data, including sound. Your mobile device
represents a transmission device which sends sound over wireless connectivity
to the speaker. The speaker then receives the sound, decodes it and amplifies
it using the built-in amplifier and speakers.

The connection process between two or more Bluetooth devices is called

however, most of the time the process is identical. You need to enable the

##### Can I pair Different Speakers Together?

##### How Does The Volume Control Work?

Now that you have the device paired, you will have a volume control on the
speaker and a volume control on your source device. The easiest way to avoid
the confusion is to set the volume on the speaker to 3/4 of the volume and
then use the controls on your phone or tablet to control to adjust the volume.

##### Will I get Interference with Bluetooth Connection?

Yes, you may. It usually comes down the distance between the connected devices
as well as the things in between them. Walls, people and other objects may
cause an unnecessary resistance and impact the signal strength. Ensure that
there is nothing between the devices and that you keep them within the range
of each other.

##### Does Bluetooth Degrade Sound Quality?

Historically it definitely did, but a lot less now. The degree of degradation
is mostly related to the quality of the codecs the manufacturer has used. With
that being said, two devices using Bluetooth 4.0 may have different levels of
impact on the sound quality. It could range from quite non-existent to
